articles.summary: Uber is in discussions with France's social security body, Urssaf. A media report suggests Urssaf believes Uber drivers should be employees. The agency is reportedly seeking significant social security contributions and penalties. This comes as Uber faces ongoing legal scrutiny across Europe regarding driver classification. Recent French Supreme Court rulings have affirmed drivers as independent workers.

articles.title: 'Stronger economic partnership': TAG members on 'huge' India-US trade deal
articles.summary: The India-US trade deal was announced on Monday after nearly a year of tense negotiations that strained the bilateral ties between New Delhi and Washington.

articles.title: Budget 2026 leaves insurance sector unchanged
articles.summary: Union Budget 2026 by Nirmala Sitharaman keeps insurance sector rules unchanged, focusing on earlier reforms and improving insurance penetration without new tax or regulatory changes.

articles.title: Stepping in for ‘Dada’, Sunetra Pawar becomes Maharashtra’s Deputy Chief Minister
articles.summary: NCP (AP) has unanimously chosen Sunetra Pawar as its legislative leader, paving the way for her swearing-in as deputy CM. Sharad Pawar said he was neither consulted nor informed about the decision.

articles.title: Mix of hope and fear settles over Venezuela a month after U.S.-imposed government change
articles.summary: As the initial shock of the U.S. raid and capture of then-President Nicolás Maduro gives way to a mix of uncertainty, hope and disappointment, a pervasive fear of another attack or more government repression continues to hang over Venezuelans.

articles.title: Paris prosecutors raid X offices as part of an investigation into child porn, deepfakes and more
articles.summary: French prosecutors are searching the Paris offices of Elon Musk’s platform X as part of a cybercrime probe. The investigation examines alleged failures to curb child abuse material, deepfakes, hate content and algorithm misuse. Musk, former CEO Linda Yaccarino and staff have been asked to cooperate as inquiries widen.

articles.title: Stockbroker Dhan’s profit jumps 2.5 times to Rs 408 crore, revenue up 2.3X
articles.summary: The Mumbai-based wealthtech player, which focusses on high-frequency professional traders, was valued at $1.2 billion last year following a $120 million infusion from Hornbill Capital and others. Founded by Pravin Jadhav, previously the CEO of Paytm Money, Dhan competes with the likes of Zerodha, Groww, and Angel One.

articles.title: One Mobikwik posts profit of Rs 4 crore in Q3

articles.title: Tariff shock to trade détente: How India's most vulnerable sectors went from worries to cheers
articles.summary: India and the US have struck a trade deal. This agreement withdraws steep US tariffs on Indian goods. Indian exporters faced significant duties, impacting sectors like textiles and marine products. Details on specific sectors are still emerging.

articles.title: India-US trade deal may boost New Delhi's growth outlook: CEA Nageswaran
articles.summary: India's economy may surpass earlier growth projections following the US's sharp tariff reduction on Indian goods. Chief Economic Adviser V. Anantha Nageswaran indicated growth could reach 7.4%, a significant upside to the government's forecast. This move is expected to boost exports, revive investment, and make India more attractive for global firms diversifying production.

articles.title: Goldman Sachs upgrades India's 2026 GDP growth to 6.9% after US cuts tariffs
articles.summary: Goldman Sachs sees a brighter economic future for India. A new trade deal with the US lowers American tariffs on Indian goods. This is expected to boost India's GDP by 0.2 percentage points. Trade tensions are easing, which could encourage private investment.

articles.title: India's seafood exports to US set to rebound after tariff cut to 18%: SEAI
articles.summary: India’s seafood exports to the US are expected to recover after Washington agreed to cut tariffs on Indian goods to 18% from 25%, the Seafood Exporters Association of India said. Exports had declined in recent months due to higher duties and uncertainty over rates.

articles.title: India's immediate end of Russian oil after US trade deal to be a big disruption: Moody's
articles.summary: India-US trade deal: India will not immediately halt Russian oil imports despite a new trade deal with the US. Moody's Ratings notes this could disrupt economic growth and increase inflation. However, reduced US tariffs will boost Indian exports, especially to the US, benefiting sectors like textiles and jewelry. This trade agreement signals improved India-US relations and supports India's export ambitions.

articles.title: Budget 2026 might have given second life to legacy industrial clusters as govt plans targeted sector upgrades
articles.summary: The government plans to revitalize 200 old industrial clusters. This initiative will focus on upgrading equipment and enhancing worker skills, with a goal to boost cost competitiveness and efficiency across various sectors. This move aims to strengthen India's manufacturing sector and ensure long-term global competitiveness.

articles.title: India-US trade deal to lift rice exports, restore parity with Thailand, Pakistan: IREF
articles.summary: Indian rice exporters welcome a new India-US trade deal. Tariffs on Indian rice exports to the US have been significantly reduced. This move restores parity with competing nations like Thailand and Pakistan. The deal is expected to boost Indian rice exports and strengthen its market share. This development brings positive sentiment to the rice export industry.

articles.title: India's January palm oil imports rise to four-month high as buyers cut soyoil purchases
articles.summary: India's edible oil imports saw a significant shift in January. Palm oil imports jumped by 51 percent, reaching a four-month peak. This surge was driven by attractive pricing compared to soyoil. Consequently, soyoil imports dropped to a 19-month low. Sunflower oil imports also declined. Overall edible oil imports decreased slightly due to these changes.

articles.title: 13 midcap stocks deliver record quarterly profits over 10 quarters
articles.summary: Thirteen NSE midcap companies reported record quarterly net profits over the past ten quarters, reflecting strong earnings momentum, operational improvements and favourable market conditions.
